review name: Worked wonders on my toddler eczema. Highly recommended!
review text: My 3, almost 4, year old son has had eczema since he was around 8 months old, and at times it can get really bad. I have a ointment that I use on the bad spots, but I don't like to use it all over his body. I did a lot of research trying to find a lotion that I felt would work best on his sensitive skin. I knew that cetaphil was a great brand for sensitive skin, so I was already partial to it, and I decided to stick with what I know. Within one day of using the lotion on him, his skin was looking better. The issue I always had with the ointment was that it was so sticky, and that his skin never felt smooth and soft, like a toddlers skin is supposed to feel like. However, after using this lotion regularly, his skin has quickly begun to feel soft and smooth. His back no longer feels rough and dry, and he doesn't have the big patch of red, scabby skin behind his knee that drove him crazy no matter how much ointment I put on it. I don't know why doctor's never told me to get lotion like this for him? They did suggest Aquaphor initially, but it did not work, and it was really sticky. This lotion soaks into his skin and makes it soft. He was so excited to be able to put lotion on like his brother (he's an identical twin). I never let he use the same lotion as his brother, but now he has his own "special" lotion, and he loves it and reminds me to put it on all the time! I definitely recommend it for mother's who have younger children with eczema. It says 'baby' on the bottle, but it works great for my toddler!

As recommended by a doctor We got this and the body wash for added measure.. Please read if you want an honest review..
THE WASH IS NOT TEAR FREE..
1st time we used the wash i about chucked it out the window.. immediately made my son cry in pain.., he screamed for 5 minutes after we got him rinsed off, it may have gotten in his eyes, we were so fixated on his cries of pain.. I assume yes.. but on a side note bc we were so worried about rinsing and calming him we omitted our normal lotion after bath treatment.. the next day we did notice a change in his facial eczema rash.. this wash did show improvement to the rash however not worth the tears üò¢.. 0 star
onto the lotion.. we tried the lotion just bc it wasn't likely to get in his eyes and cause the same reaction.. as I apply a thin layer to an area needing it on his leg.. it too seemed to burn him.. as he started rubbing at the area I just applied it too and would wiggle and moan out in discomfort and started scratching immediately üò¢ again 0 star
My Recommendation is TRY SOMETHING ELSE.. and do your research and read reviews.. I had a parenting fail here please learn from my mistake..

Tried this because the Averno Baby Eczema Therapy seemed to be just barely managing my 6 month old's mild-ish eczema, and I wanted better than just barely. Upon this lotion touching her skin, my daughter screamed, writhed, and cried in pain. It was heartbreaking, and we will not be using this again.

Our infant has gone back-and-forth with eczema-like dry skin patches. I've tried lotions and washes by Aveeno Baby and Babyganics, but I never saw a difference. I've been using the Cetaphil Baby wash with calendula on my toddler and had great results with keeping him moisturized after a bath, so decided to try this Cetaphil eczema line. It has actually worked with our infant! There is not much of a scent in either the lotion or the wash, but I love that the lotion does not leave any greasy/tacky/sticky feeling after it's been rubbed in. It seems to absorb quickly and leave her skin moisturized. The dry skin patches have slowly gone away, to the point that I forget they were even there. I'd recommend at least trying this line if your baby has dry skin patches/eczema. We're very pleasantly surprised!

I bought this eczema lotion for my 2 month old baby.He has very dry,itchy,rough skin and white patches is there.i applied this lotion after he took bath,immediately the white patches vanished and skin became very soft and shiny.The most impressive thing about this lotion i,it works good for 24 hours.This lotion consistency is mid of thick to running and it spreads well on skin and quickly absorbed.Not much oily
Totally very good lotion for dry baby skin

review name: Good effective product for my baby who has mid-severe eczema
review text: Very lightweight and fast absorbing. My 1 year old has eczema since 3months old. It affects full body mostly back, neck and legs and feet. Coconut oil maintains her skin on regular days but when she has eczema flare I needed a product to calm it. This cream works well. I use it twice a day and right after bath for my baby. 2 times the flare went away in just a couple of applications (and with no steroid cream). I also use bath oil to prevent dryness from bathing.

We used this lotion on our 7-month old son four times. The first three times our baby screamed and cried each time, which was unusual. But we just thought he was being moody. The fourth and last time, we put it on him when he was falling asleep. He immediately woke up and started screaming and crying until we washed the lotion off with water... We do not know whether it's the product or it's because of its authenticity, but it's not ok for products like this to be on the market... As parents, we never want to see our babies suffer. We felt horribly guilty for this purchase.

review name: Highly recommend for kids and babies with eczema!
review text: Our son is 2 years old and has been struggling with eczema since he was a little over 1 year. We recently had to take him to a dermatologist, who recommended this brand of lotion and gave us some samples, and it is the absolute best thing ever. Before, we were putting cortisone cream (a steroid cream) on his legs, stomach, arms, and face multiple times a day, every day and he would STILL be itchy and miserable many days. Now, we put this on those areas plus Vaseline (to lock in the moisture) once, sometimes twice, a day and his skin has never looked better. He still has little flare ups now and then, when we need to use the steroid cream, but not more than maybe a couple times a month. I HIGHLY recommend this for any parent to try if their kids are having similar issues!

review name: and I am now in love. It is AMAZING for my really chronically dry
review text:
This didn't do much for my baby, but when I saw my pediatrician he said the rash was dermatitis and not eczema, so I can't say how it worked for treating eczema. However, I gave it 5 stars because my hands get so dry they crack in the winter, and one day I just used a pump of this lotion because it was nearby, and I am now in love. It is AMAZING for my really chronically dry, cracked hands, and a little goes a long way. I am keeping it for myself and will order again for myself. Why they market this magic lotion towards *only* baby eczema is beyond me.

So, try it on your baby. Worst case scenario is that it doesn't help the eczema but you end up with a fabulous lotion.

I didn‚Äôt receive what was ordered. I had ordered Cetaphil‚Äôs ‚ÄúEczema Calming Lotion‚Äù and instead received ‚ÄúEczema Soothing Lotion‚Äù. The soothing lotion is approximately half the price, and is no where near as effective as the calming lotion for my 6 months old sensitive skin. We always buy the Calming lotion at the local Walgreens; however they have been sold out of it for months, which is what lead me here. BUYER BEWARE.
Bought this after much research looking for something to soothe baby's dry skin/eczema. Within hours he was all red and blotchy. Poor guy, I threw this in the trash immediately!

review name: Great for Faces, Not for Bodies
review text: Our baby has had eczema since he was a month old. His skin never seemed to bother him itch-wise, but we wanted to see if we could find a new lotion to smooth out his skin. This has transformed his little cheeks, which are now very smooth! However, it's done nothing for his arms and legs, even though we slather him with it. I'd get it for milder eczema but it doesn't seem to do much for more severe body eczema.

I had Allergic dermatitis on eyelids for months. I tried hydrocortisone cream and other eczema creams, nothing helped. I read the ingredients on this, which are minimal and thought I may as well give it a try before buying the prescription Elidel which costs a lot and may not work . I am glad I tried this. There is no scent, it‚Äôs given me some relief, there is a slight stinging on my eyelids after I apply this lotion, but it has not caused more irritation like everything else did.

review text: We bought this bc our baby has very sensitive skin and eczema. First off it smells very chemically. Plus after one use she broke out into a horrible rash. We thought she was having an allergic reaction. Not only did it not moisturize but it caused her skin to tighten up due to swelling and redness. Very, very upset !!
This made my baby's eczema way worse! Not sure why the ingredients are so different from the wash but this contains a few ingredients that can worsen eczema.

I'll use this lotion myself when my skin just begins to itch. It has calmed the itching on the few occasions I've used it. It's nice because it really doesn't have any scent to it and my skin absorbs it nicely. My only complaint about it is that the bottle is way too small for an adult to use this as a "body" lotion. If I did that, it wouldn't last 2 weeks.

I bought the wash and the lotion feeling a bit skeptical because I tried so many things for his dry skin and nothing worked. Then I came across and decided let me try this. It‚Äôs been two days and his skin has gotten a LOT better. It‚Äôs a lot softer than before.

But it does it‚Äôs job on soothing eczema/dry skin.

review name: Great for dry skin and eczema!
review text: This is the ONLY lotion that clears up my toddlers dry skin. We have been using this since she was a baby. She will get eczema if her skin gets too dry. As soon as I feel dry skin or she starts to itch I apply this lotion and it immediately moisturizes her skin. If she has any signs of eczema this lotion will clear it up after just a few applications. It never burns her skin and soaks in quickly. I feel like the lotion is a little pricey but it is worth it since it is the only lotion that works on her skin.

I use this on my baby's face twice a day, during morning and night. I like how it's not scented. My baby has sensitive skin and this lotion really does it's job by moisturizing and also help getting rid of eczema. Sometimes when he gets diaper rashes I also apply it to his butt to help get rid of the redness sooner. Definitely a great product and have ordered it multiple times already.

I'm not sure if it's the soap that I used or if it's this product my two-year-old has very bad eczema and it's like I put it on his skin I use the lotion I can give him a bath or bathe him with Dove sensitive skin I gave him a bath I rub this all over his body and then the next thing I know like two days later he broke out in hives so I'm not sure if it's using the product in combination with something else or if it's the actual product so I'm going to do a test and I'll give another review on it once I'm done

Small and highly priced, but I can't seem to find another product that works as well. I also can't find this very many places besides Amazon.

review text: The lotion works wonders on my son. During the bad days I apply 2x a day and all his rough patches disappear.

review name: Didn't realize it was not tear free so I don't ...
review text: Didn't realize it was not tear free so I don't want to use it on my baby. It would be hard not to get some in eyes during a bath. But I use it for myself!

I like this product and use it in conjunction with the Cetaphil Baby Eczema Calming Wash. My son has a "pretty good case of eczema" according to our pediatrician. But if I'm vigilant about using this a few times a day, and washing every other day with the wash, it keeps the eczema under control and baby feels fine. We were given a referral to a pediatric dermatologist, but so far I haven't made an appointment because I feel like the Cetaphil products are working well for us. I also use 1% hydrocortisone on the worst spots (bends in arms and legs).
Very good

review text: It's pricey, but worth every penny. Using this in combination with the soap has completely cleared up my baby's eczema, which he had on both feet and ankles.

review name: Brought peace of mind for us!
review text: Our new born have some issues with kind of eczema initial stage and doctor suggested to keep his skin moist most of the times but sometimes its hard for baby to keep the moisturizer on his skin for long time since he goes here and there and the cream goes off. Found this online, would liked to give it a try with some hope in CETAPHIL brand and it worked out really well. Our son is out of eczema pretty soon. this gave us a great peace of mind. Highly recommended as we used it personally and go to use small babies. we use on our son from when he is about 3 months or so.

review name: I am so happy that these are available--they work and are such a ...
review text:
I have used several Cetaphil products on myself and my kids. I have had so many recommendations from pediatricians and dermatologists for their lotions and washes. I am so happy that these are available--they work and are such a good value.

I have rosacea so I have to be very cautious about products I use on my face. This Baby Eczema Calming lotion does a great job on the redness and rough/itchy areas on my face and it also is perfect to use on my babies and kids. We live in the Midwest and this is the best product for windburned or chapped faces. It is lightweight enough they don't mind me putting it on. I like Aquaphor also, but it is so thick they generally object to me applying it to their faces.

It is very lightly scented and doesn't sting when applied to red and raw areas. We have all been very happy with this lotion for multiple uses.

review name: It Works Better Than Anything Else We Tried!!
review text:
This product is phenomenal. We have tried several moisturizers and lotions that claim to calm and soothe eczema, but this one truly delivered. And, it delivered quickly (quicker than any product we have tried thus far).

While the container is relatively small, it makes sense to me since this is intended for infants and (in most cases) will be applied sparingly and to specific, afflicted areas.

The contents are of a medium consistency, but rapidly work into skin (especially if one warms it in one's hands before applying to baby). If applied correctly, it should not be sticky/tacky. (However, I once applied over-zealously and it was definitely tacky ... directly as a result of my overuse though). Likewise, there is virtually no scent/fragrance. So, those who are sensitive to scents/fragrance should be okay with this product.

This is highly recommended for soothing and calming the skin of infants. Truly outstanding. We will be purchasing this from now on.

I have the regular version. Same brand, just not marked for babies. Just like with the calming wash, which also comes in regular and baby, I can't tell the difference. They are both good. But I suspect that my skin is normal. If my skin were sensitive, I'll bet I would notice the difference.

I wear jeans, and my calves tend to get itchy during the day. With the wash, followed by this lotion, I make it through the majority of the day without feeling itchy. My dermatologist recommended Cepaphil's eczema products, so it must be more than my imagination. One thing I don't do, is use the lotion before bed, like my dermatologist told me. The lotion does a very good job of moisturizing, which to me, feels on the oily side. That's why I put it on in the morning before going to work.

My 3 yro daughter has mild eczema and this lotion does a good job of keeping her dryness under control. It truly is fragrance free. I literally cannot smell ANYTHING! It glides on easily, doesn't feel sticky, and dries quickly. I'm not sure how well it'd work for more severe eczema because I've used more moisturizing products in the past (like this one¬†

review name: Good lotion for dry skin and helps to relieve itching. It is also fragrance, paraben and soap free.
review text:
Our LO has sensitive skin (atopic dermatitis that comes and goes) and we find they itch themselves, especially during naps / sleep. With the cooler weather coming dry skin will require adequate moisturizing.

We use this calming lotion in combination with¬†

review name: Fragrance free (really) balm for itchy, dry irritable skin.
review text: I have very sensitive skin, prone to eczema and dermatitis. Every dermatologist I have ever seen says the same thing....hydrate, hydrate, hydrate. When my skin is problematic, I want fragrance free relief. This is it. No scent, not greasy but very calming and soothing. I happen to believe in preventing skin problems and I think judicious application of a high quality lotion is part of the answer. I love this lotion for my adult skin problems. I have a bottle at work, home and at the gym. I highly recommend it.

3.5 stars. This Cetaphil lotion is very thin in consistency for a 'lotion'. It's absorbed into the skin very quickly and is not too sticky. It doesn't rub off on clothing which is great. It is a very mild lotion and is very soothing. For my little girl, it is not as effective on her eczema. I normally use Aveeno on her and that seems to work better on her skin. The Cetaphil's light consistency may be better in the warmer months so I'm keeping it as an option.

At 5 ounces, this stuff works really well, but for the same price I can get 18 ounces of Aveeno baby daily moisture lotion that works almost as well. I went through this container in a couple of weeks on my two year old with eczema, so if you had more than one child, it would really not be cost effective at all.

If you've tried everything for baby eczema and nothing seems to work, this may be worth a shot. Otherwise, there are many cheaper alternatives.

I have the calming wash (great stuff) and this lotion is a nice addition to the mix. I have psoriasis on my hands, so hand washing can irritate it. The cleansing lotion works very well and I use this in between and at night as needed. It does seem to help. I have always been happy with other Cetaphil products and like this one as well. A bit expensive, but most of these products are.

My son is 2 and has eczema on his cheeks. Our normal everyday regiment is a petroleum based eczema product or vaseline (unless its bad, then we go to the prescription). This lotion is great and we are switching to it! For some reason our normal regiment, makes my son yell and he doesn't like the feel on his face, but he doesn't even fuss when I use this lotion. Great product!

review name: Good and long lasting eczema lotion
review text:
We used this with the eczema wash and find that the lotion really lasts over 6 hours and helped our boys decrease their itchiness.

So far we used the Aveeno - which has a oat extracts which worked as well. We had also tried the Cetaphil regular.

The only thing that seems to work is the Cetaphil calming lotion (this product) and the Aveeno

My three children all have very sensitive, eczema prone skin & I am very particular about what I use on them. I love Aquaphor & use it more frequently than any other product but also use Cetaphil when I want something less rich. This really works great. It's nice & moisturizing without being too thick or sticky. My kids have not had any eczema flare ups since I began using this on them. I really like this lotion.

review name: Our kids have sensitive skin but it is getting better, and this has never caused any issues and ...
review text: This is designed for a baby, but we use it for our kids (5 and 7) and have also been known to use it on ourselves. Our kids have sensitive skin but it is getting better, and this has never caused any issues and has gone on well (without the kids complaining too much).

Our little guy has seasonal eczema that flares whenever the seasons change. This lotion has certainly helped us keep it under control. I wouldn't call his eczema severe but rather mild. This lotion isn't as thick as some of the eczema lotions out there. It has no scent. I recommend for mild eczema.

As soon as the weather changes my daughters skin instantly starts to feel chalky and dry and she itches it constantly. She has had eczema as a baby and the only thing her pediatrician would do is prescribe a cortisone cream. I have found it is just easier and better for her health wise to prevent an eczema outbreak by constantly nourishing her skin.

What I like most about this product compared to others that are targeted for eczema is that it feels thick but it absorbs and goes onto her skin easily without leaving a greasy feel. I also like that this is fragrance free. There is no reason to add fragrance to sensitive skin.

Nice and light, soothing but not sticky. No real scent that I can discern, which is a definite plus. I found it works well on some patches of skin that are constantly itchy but the effects fade quicker than I'd like. The price point is a bit high for such a small bottle, but this size would be perfect for a travel bag or a diaper bag.

Great product and a little goes a long way. Helped quickly and easily relieve my baby's irritation from eczema but bought it for half the price at Publix supermarket. It's probably even cheaper at Walmart or a different supermarket. Same size.

review name: It bought it for my toddlers eczema. Unlike cortizone ...
review text: It bought it for my toddlers eczema. Unlike cortizone that seems to harden the skin and make it look scaly, this cream at least makes the skin look smooth and moisturized. Also the redness has reduced. However, it does not seem to reduce the scratching. I use it with combination of cortizone.

Calms but doesn't cure. But then I wasn't expecting a cure. This is a nice soothing lotion for babies red, inflamed and "angry" skin.
I recommend it highly. We are pleased with how it is taking care of our granddaughter's skin. So is my DIL.

Love this product! My little girl has been getting eczema since she was newborn, she is now 15 months. I have tried several different brands and nothing has worked like Cetaphil. I do use the Eczema calming wash and then follow it with the eczema lotion. She has almost instant relief. Plus, it doesn‚Äôt leave a greasy feeling all over my hands.

My 2 year old has the chicken skin type excema and this really helped clear up his skin and the rough patches on his cheeks. I use this lotion where he had it the most (stomach and back) and saw a nice improvement.

My kids both suffer from eczema. This lotion actually "burns" their skin when I put it on, their words, not mine. This is typical with lotion over ointment for them though. It fades quickly and when the lotion absorbs it actually really does a good job healing their skin. Even though they don't prefer this to the ointment, I like how clean it goes on and absorbs, plus it does the job as intended!

review name: good for sensitive skin of new born
review text: i tried everything for my little new born's extra sensitive skin nothing suits but this.
My little one's eczema is very mild, so I'm not using this constantly. It does seem to make a difference when I do use it though; his skin is a lot smoother.
This is a wonderful product. It helps a lot. Wonderful for a dry climate or a baby with eczema.

review text: Both of my kids have a touch of eczema. We have gone through a few different soaps and lotions to keep it in check. This stuff has worked pretty well (in conjunction with the Cetaphil Baby Eczema Calming Wash). My kids' skin feels great and nice and moisturized after use.
Quick ship, item as described.

review text: It is said that the cause of atopy in England. This is due to the lack of filaggrin in the skin. So I bought this product because it contains Filaggrin. We expect to have effect.
